name: df-ipf
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cipf, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cip, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))
comment: Define the inner product function. Usually we will use ` .i ` directly instead of ` .if ` , and they have the same behavior in most cases. The main advantage of ` .if ` is that it is a guaranteed function ( ~ ipffn ), while ` .i ` only has closure ( ~ ipcl ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2015.)
